name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"36dc9600-561a-4408-ad9e-90bda03d19c9","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: analyze_submodules","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7f69ddbd-ce1c-49d1-ab6e-58f51104ea33","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_submodules","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function acts as a high-level coordinator for processing the dependencies discovered during the analysis of a primary module. It identifies all modules that have been imported or referenced and ensures they are analyzed using the same rules and shared state as the current module. It delegates the actual execution to a base class method while passing along the full suite of specialized "Managers" (Scope, Definition, Import, etc.) to maintain a unified semantic model of the entire project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cec47727-ac69-4bb7-9289-66e39961ffeb","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis is rarely limited to a single file. To understand how code behaves, the analyzer must be able to follow the trail of imports (e.g., if ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" imports ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it must analyze ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to understand the functions ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is using). This function ensures that this recursive exploration is performed consistently. By sharing the same ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"callStack","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visited_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"DefinitionManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it prevents the analyzer from reprocessing the same file multiple times and ensures that cross-file references (like a class in one file inheriting from a class in another) are resolved correctly.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c14244f4-b607-4b09-8c10-b4c53a9707d4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3be4310b-de78-4360-bd2d-9199405a9f6c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"State Synchronization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It gathers the current state of the analyzer, including all the specialized management objects (Import, Scope, Definition, Class, Module, Call, and Return managers).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6c060ac2-8e85-454a-bcd5-eb68e2cde0f8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Passing:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It retrieves the list of already-analyzed modules via ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_modules_analyzed()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ensure the process remains efficient and avoids infinite loops.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"db33751b-9efe-4599-acba-981b2cf2a4d6","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Base Delegation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It calls the base class's ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_submodules","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method. It passes the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class itself as an argument, allowing the base logic to instantiate new processors for each discovered submodule.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c2a55aea-8bb5-433c-b664-1b965a382554","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Recursive Processing:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The base logic identifies submodules that haven't been visited yet and triggers a full analysis cycle for each, using the provided managers to store the results in a shared project database.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"693bb1bc-f06a-43fe-83aa-3358d4c1d5d9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"If you analyze ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which imports ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"database.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8c1a2b5a-83b6-4722-8775-160c4b72f2fe","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The analyzer finishes the initial pass of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3940b777-f649-4596-bf09-b045a24eb0df","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_submodules","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f249e3b9-ce0a-4cf7-82d0-b3808e188d6c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The function sees that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"database","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" have been imported but not yet fully analyzed.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e33e4161-5f5d-4c6d-91cc-d1c202e83f62","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It launches a recursive analysis for both, ensuring that any classes or functions defined in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are now available to the code in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8f6e048c-1e69-4cad-b477-49decbeabcc1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
